result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

miscConds.notes: Fine of $600.00, all applicable court costs, fees, surcharges and DNA surcharge.  To be paid over period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant:   that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that her voting privleges are suspended and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Not to drive any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Comply with the standard rules of probation /extended supervison.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Release privileges for childcare, employment, treatment and Day Reporting Center purposes only.

***DECISION & ORDER  dated April 22, 2015; Court GRANTS gpod time credit to apply to this condition time***.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dawn M Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Granting Request For Good Time; received, filed and signed by the Court on April 22, 2015; Copies distributed to parties. File back to closing to amend JOC. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

-The defendant's motion to reduce the cost of installing and maintaining an ignition interlock device is GRANTED; received, filed and signed by the Court on April 22, 2015; Copies distributed to parties.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for good time and for half-price ignition interlock exemption.

THE DEFENDANT'S MOTION FOR RELEASE PRIVILEGES IS DENIED.   ADDITIONAL RELEASE PRIVILEGES WOULD UNDULY DEPRECIATE THE SERIOUSNESS OF THE OFFENSE, RENDER THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION TIME MEANINGLESS, AND FRUSTRATE THE COURT'S SPECIFIC SENTENCING INTENT.  Order signed and filed. jks
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for additional release privileges.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report; filed.

Defendant Dawn M Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS. Credit given for 3 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for child care, employment, treatment, and Day Reporting Center purposes only.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY fine in the amount of $600.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are REVOKED for a period of 30 months.  Reinstatement fee to apply.
* Defendant is not to drive any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 24 months.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Court Order for IDP Related Offenser Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report.

Defendant Dawn M Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
